title: Hyundai Ioniq 5
content:

The '''Hyundai Ioniq 5''' ({{lang-ko|현대 아이오닉 5}}) is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]]<ref name="cd2023" /> produced by [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] since 2021. It is the first product to be marketed under the electric cars-focused [[Ioniq]] sub-brand, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]].<ref>{{cite news |author1=Joey Capparella |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Production EV Previewed before February Reveal |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |access-date=15 January 2021 |date=13 January 2021 |archive-date=29 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210329110807/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

== Overview ==
The Ioniq 5 was revealed globally on 23 February 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Revealed With Concept Look, Ultra-Fast Charging |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070351/https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref> Its design was previewed by the Hyundai 45 EV Concept which was presented at the [[International Motor Show Germany#2019|Frankfurt Motor Show]] in September 2019. Both the concept car and the production version are inspired by the original [[Hyundai Pony]],<ref>{{Cite web|last=Meiners|first=Jens|date=12 April 2021|title=1970s Hyundai Pony Restored with EV Powertrain, Ultra-Cool Interior|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|access-date=2 July 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=17 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210417052442/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|url-status=live}}</ref> and features the Parametric Pixel design that is applied to the headlights, tail lights, and wheels. The vehicle's clamshell hood spans the entire width to make a sleek look with the 20-inch aerodynamic wheels.<ref>{{Cite news|title=미래형 전기차 '아이오닉 5' 이미지 첫 공개… "살짝 설렜어 난"|work=서울신문|url=https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver|url-status=live|access-date=13 January 2021|archive-date=28 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128004911/https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver}}</ref> The "45" describes both the 45th anniversary of the Pony coupe and the 45-degree angles prominent on the sides of the concept.<ref>{{cite news |author=Priddle, Alisa |date=10 September 2019 |title=Remember the Hyundai Pony? EV Concept Honors Brand's First Car in Frankfurt |work=Motor Trend |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/hyundai-pony-45-ev-concept-electric-compact-frankfurt-first-look/ |access-date=22 December 2021}}</ref> At the time, Hyundai called the design language "sensuous sportiness" and described the front and rear lights as carrying a "kinetic cube" theme.<ref>{{cite news |author=Halvorson, Bengt |date=11 September 2019 |title=Hyundai hatches an electric future with retro 45 EV concept |work=Green Car Reports |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1124993_hyundai-hatches-an-electric-future-with-retro-45-ev-concept |access-date=22 December 2021}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 was developed under the project code ''NE'' as the first vehicle to be based on the E-GMP platform.<ref>{{cite web|author=Florent Ferrière|date=10 August 2020|title=Hyundai : Ioniq devient une marque, premier modèle en 2021|url=https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|publication-date=|access-date=15 September 2020|archive-date=24 September 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200924210726/https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Brett T.|title=Hyundai Teases Upcoming 2022 Ioniq 5 EV With Three Images|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/d|access-date=15 January 2021|website=motor1.com|archive-date=9 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211009144028/https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/|url-status=live}}</ref> The dedicated electric vehicle platform enables the vehicle to adopt a fully flat interior floor with a 3-meter long wheelbase. The flat floor allows Hyundai engineers to develop a sliding front central console marketed as 'Universal Island', which is able to slide backwards by {{cvt|140|mm|in|1}}. The vehicle has a cargo capacity of {{cvt|531|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} behind the rear seats that can be increased to nearly {{cvt|1600|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} with the second row seats folded. The rear legroom space was achieved by making the front seats approximately 30 percent thinner than typical seats.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Ruffo |first=Gustavo Henrique |date=2023-02-23 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Revealed As Sleek, Stylish CUV: It's Not A Hatchback |url=https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223074826/https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

The dashboard of the Ioniq 5 is made up of two {{cvt|12|in|mm}} screens, one for the instrument cluster display and the other for the infotainment system, both under one piece of glass. It is equipped with an optional [[head-up display]] with [[augmented reality]] support. Many of the interior parts are made from recycled materials, including [[PET bottles]]. The Ioniq 5 can be optioned with a single large glass panel roof without any support beams.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Beresford|first=Colin|date=23 February 2021|title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Kicks Off EV Lineup in Eye-Catching Style|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070421/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|url-status=live}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 also features a front boot (alternatively called a frunk), which has a {{cvt|57|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity for the RWD version (except North America), while the AWD model and all North American versions have a {{cvt|24|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity, due to the extra mechanical components underneath to support the front electric motor.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 revealed with impressive numbers, concept car looks|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Autoblog|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070611/https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|url-status=live}}</ref> It has the ability to charge electrical equipment through the built-in [[Vehicle-to-grid|V2L (Vehicle to Load)]] function. It can supply up to 3.6{{nbsp}}kW of power from the port mounted under the rear seats (except Australia) and from another port installed outside. The exterior port is able to supply power even if the vehicle is turned off.

In some markets, the Ioniq 5 is offered with an optional Digital Side Mirror (DSM) which replaces the conventional side mirrors with cameras and [[OLED]] screens.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Digital Side Mirror Works Just Fine: Test Drive |url=https://insideevs.com/reviews/510105/hyundai-ioniq5-digital-side-mirror/ |access-date=2022-09-19 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

<gallery widths="200" heights="133">
File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Uniq-Paket – h 27062021.jpg|Rear view
File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 IAA 2021 1X7A0217.jpg|Interior
File:Hyundai 45 EV Concept at IAA 2019 IMG 0683.jpg|Hyundai 45 EV Concept (2019)
</gallery>

== {{anchor|N}} Ioniq 5 N ==
The Ioniq 5 N was introduced on 14 July 2023 during the [[Goodwood Festival of Speed]]. The variant is the top-of-the-line model, marketed under the [[Hyundai N]] performance sub-brand.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai has finally unleashed its electric 600bhp Ioniq 5 N |url=https://www.topgear.com/car-news/electric/hyundai-has-finally-unleashed-its-electric-600bhp-ioniq-5-n |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Top Gear |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Doll |first=Scooter |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 N debuts at Goodwood, kicking off new era of performance-cornering EVs |url=https://electrek.co/2023/07/13/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-debut-goodwood-new-performance-cornering-ev/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Electrek |language=en-US}}</ref>

The exterior changes include a revised front end with larger air intakes, with additional air curtains and air flaps for improved cooling. The rear portion gained a rear wiper, wing-type spoiler integrated with a triangular third brake light, and a rear [[Diffuser (automotive)|diffuser]]. With extended wheel arches and wider [[Axle track|track]], the Ioniq 5 N is {{cvt|50|mm|in|1}} wider than the standard model and also {{cvt|20|mm|in|1}} lower.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=2023-07-14 |title=2024 Hyundai Ioniq 5 N debuts - performance EV with 650 PS; simulated 8DCT, engine sounds; 0-100 in 3.4s - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2023/07/14/2024-hyundai-ioniq-5-n-debuts/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref>

The [[body in white]] structure of the Ioniq 5 N gains 42 additional welding points and {{cvt|2.1|m|in|0|abbr=on}} of additional adhesives for improved rigidity. The motor and battery mountings were also reinforced, while the [[subframe]]s were enhanced for lateral rigidity. Its power steering has a higher ratio and improved torque feedback.

The vehicle is equipped with two electric motors, providing a total of {{cvt|448|kW|PS hp|0}} and {{cvt|740|Nm|kgm lbft|sigfig=3}} of torque. However, Hyundai equipped the Ioniq 5 N with an N Grin Boost mode, allowing a maximum output of {{cvt|478|kW|PS hp|0}} and {{cvt|770|Nm|kgm lbft|sigfig=3}} of torque being released for 10 seconds. Hyundai claimed a {{cvt|0-100|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}} acceleration figure of 3.5 seconds, or 3.4 seconds with the N Grin Boost mode activated. The [[lithium-ion battery]] for this variant is also extended to 84 kWh.<ref name=":1" />

Several aspects were conceived to simulate an [[Internal combustion engine|internal combustion vehicle]]. An N e-shift function emulates the feel of a 8-speed [[Dual-clutch transmission|dual-clutch automatic]] transmission, by controlling motor torque to simulate the jolt between shifts. A system called N Active Sound+ uses eight interior and two exterior speakers to play three different sound themes based on throttle position, such as a 2.0-liter turbocharged petrol engine from other Hyundai N cars, futuristic EV themes and twin-engine fighter jet sounds.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N runs on electrons but simulates an ICE car |url=https://www.motorauthority.com/news/1140092_hyundai-ioniq-5-n-performance-revealed |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Motor Authority |language=en}}</ref><gallery widths="200" heights="150">
File:Hyundai IONIQ 5 N NE N Performance Blue (6).jpg|Ioniq 5 N
File:Hyundai IONIQ 5 N NE N Performance Blue (14).jpg|Rear view
File:Hyundai IONIQ 5 N NE N Black Alcantara Suede (1).jpg|Interior
</gallery>

=== Ioniq 5 eN1 Cup ===
During the Hyundai N festival in December of 2023, Hyundai revealed concept images of the Ioniq 5 eN1 Cup car, a racing variant of the Ioniq 5 N, with the goal of finishing the development in February of 2024. The car features an aerodynamic bodykit, including air intakes, a rear diffuser, and a rear wing. It also features a stiffer suspension setup, lowering the ride height by 2.8 inches. The car is also said to be about 250 kg lighter than its road going counterpart.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Is Officially Going Racing |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/699916/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-cup/ |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref> Each racing team will have access to a special version of the Sound+ system, and drivers will be able to use N Grin Boost for extra power during overtakes, and N e-shift to add virtual gears The plan is for this car to start racing in May of 2024 in its own one-make EV series in Korea.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pappas |first=Thanos |date=8 December 2023 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Spawns Electric Racecar For Single-Make Series |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2023/12/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-spawns-electric-racecar-for-single-make-series/ |access-date=18 December 2023 |website=carscoops.com}}</ref> 

== Powertrain ==
From vehicle launch to mid-2022, the international market Long Range Ioniq 5 initially had 72.6 kWh gross battery pack, which has since then been upgraded to 77.4 kWh gross capacity, a 58 kWh gross battery pack is available for the Standard Range model. The North American version is only available with the 58 kWh for Standard Range models or the newer 77.4 kWh batteries for Long Range models. Every Ioniq 5 has a top speed of {{convert|185|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{Cite web|title=2022 Ioniq 5 revealed: Retro-styled electric car leads a New Wave of EVs|url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Green Car Reports|date=23 February 2021 |language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223094136/https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|url-status=live}}</ref>

The battery can recharge {{convert|86|km|mi|abbr=on}} of range in 5 minutes, or from 10 to 80% in 18 minutes, or {{convert|375|km|mi|abbr=on}} in half an hour<ref>{{cite web |last1=Klingenberg |first1=Mathias |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5: Plutselig kan elbilen fylle energi om kapp med bensinbilen |url=https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |website=Tu.no |publisher=[[Teknisk Ukeblad]] |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20210615170639/https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |archive-date=15 June 2021 |language=no |date=15 June 2021 |url-status=live}}</ref> with its 800{{nbsp}}V charging capabilities by using a 350{{nbsp}}kW charger. The peak battery speeds for the 58 kWh Standard Range are around 175 kW while it is around 230 kW on the 77.4 kWh Long Range. The 800{{nbsp}}V [[Power inverter|inverter]] is sourced from Vitesco Technologies, a subsidiary of the [[Continental AG|Continental]] group.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Randall|first=Chris|date=24 March 2021|title=Vitesco to deliver 800-volt inverters for Hyundai's E-GMP|url=https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|access-date=8 April 2021|website=Electrive|language=en-us|archive-date=25 March 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210325031900/https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|url-status=live}}</ref> A five minutes charge will add {{cvt|100|km|mi|0}} to its range by [[WLTP (driving cycle)|WLTP]] standards.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gitlin|first=Jonathan M.|date=23 February 2021|title=Here's the first of Hyundai's new 800-volt EVs—the Ioniq 5|url=https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Ars Technica|language=en-us|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223103405/https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|url-status=live}}</ref>

{| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align:left; font-size:90%;"

== Markets ==

=== United States ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in the U.S. in May 2021, and went on sale in December 2021 as a 2022-year model.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Gauthier |first=Michael |date=2021-12-13 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Offers 220 Miles Of Range For $39,700 While 303 Mile Variant Will Set You Back $43,650 |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/12/hyundai-ioniq-5-offers-220-miles-of-range-for-39700-while-303-mile-variant-will-set-you-back-43650/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}}</ref> The initial model year is equipped with a 77.4 kWh battery. The entry-level models are powered by a rear-mounted single motor producing {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the more powerful models are available as a dual-motor version with AWD and {{cvt|239|kW|PS hp|0}} power output.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Karkafiris |first=Michael |date=2021-05-24 |title=America's 2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Detailed, Here's Everything You Need To See And Know |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/05/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed-for-us-market-with-up-to-320-hp-and-up-to-300-miles-of-range/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}}</ref> A Standard Range model with a 58 kWh battery and a power output of {{cvt|125|kW|PS hp|0}} was released in spring 2022.<ref name=":0" /> Specific to the American and Canadian Ioniq 5, the vehicle is equipped a marker inside the headlamps, and tail lamps that blink completely as turn indicators.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-12-09 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5: Everything we know in Dec 2022 |url=https://topelectricsuv.com/news/hyundai/hyundai-ioniq-5-details-pre-orders/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=topelectricsuv.com |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Europe ===
Initial models of the Ioniq 5 in Europe was offered with a choice of two battery packs (58 kWh and 72.6 kWh), three power outputs and either rear or four-wheel drive.<ref>{{Cite web |title=New 2021 Hyundai Ioniq 5: UK prices and specs confirmed |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/hyundai/107696/new-2021-hyundai-ioniq-5-uk-prices-and-specs-confirmed |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Auto Express |language=en}}</ref> During its introduction, a limited edition called the Project 45 was available, and only 3,000 units were made.<ref>{{Cite web |last=George |first=Jeo |date=2022-02-03 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Project 45 edition gets 3X expected response [Update] |url=https://electricvehicleweb.com/hyundai-ioniq-5-uk/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |language=en-US}}</ref>

In April 2022, the Ioniq 5 received a larger battery for the European market. The previous 72.6 kWh battery was replaced with a 77.4 kWh battery with an increased power output by {{cvt|8|kW|PS hp|0}} to {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the entry-level 58 kWh battery option remains. Optional Digital Centre Mirror (DCM) and Digital Side Mirrors (DSM) also became available.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets Larger 77.4 kWh Battery In Europe |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/581860/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-update/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Europe: 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Enhancements Announced |url=https://insideevs.com/news/566583/europe-2023-hyundai-ioniq5-enhancements/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

=== Australia ===
The Ioniq 5 went on sale in Australia on 27 September 2021,<ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-09-21 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 pricing and features revealed for Australia |url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Carscoops |language=en}}</ref> in a sole grade, using the Long Range powertrain with the option between RWD (single motor) and AWD (dual motor) setups.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-09-20 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 pricing and features revealed for Australia |url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Which Car? Australia |language=en}}</ref> Three grades are available: Dynamiq, Techniq, and Epiq, with AWD standard on the top grade.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2023-01-19 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV pricing: More coming January 19|url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia-more-confirmed|access-date=2023-10-18|website=Which Car? Australia|language=en}}</ref>

=== Malaysia ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Malaysia on 9 March 2022, with three grades: Lite, Plus and Max. Two powertrain options are available: Standard Range (RWD) and Long Range (AWD), the latter powertrain comes standard on the top grade.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-03-09 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched in Malaysia – 58 kWh, 72.6 kWh AWD, 430 km range, from RM199,888 |url=https://paultan.org/2022/03/09/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-in-malaysia-58-kwh-2wd-lite-plus-72-6-kwh-awd-max-from-rm200k/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Paul Tan Automotive News |language=en}}</ref>

=== Indonesia ===
The Ioniq 5 was introduced in Indonesia in March 2022, and went on sale in April 2022. It is available in Prime and Signature grades, with each grade have the option between Standard Range and Long Range powertrains.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-04-01 |title=Hyundai Introduces Ioniq 5 Electric Car Made in Indonesia |url=https://www.theindonesia.id/news/2022/04/01/100000/hyundai-introduces-ioniq-5-electric-car-made-in-indonesia |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=theindonesia.id |language=english}}</ref> It is assembled in the country at [[Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Indonesia|Hyundai's plant]] in [[Cikarang|Cikarang, West Java]] with a targeted annual production of 1,500 units.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-03-17 |title=Hyundai opens EV factory in Indonesia – RM6.5 billion plant to build Ioniq 5, 250,000 unit production capacity - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2022/03/17/hyundai-opens-ev-factory-in-indonesia-cikarang-plant-to-build-ioniq-5-250000-unit-production-capacity/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=최경애 |date=2022-05-01 |title=(LEAD) Orders for Hyundai's IONIQ 5 soar in Indonesia |url=https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20220501001551320 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Yonhap News Agency |language=en}}</ref> 

Since April 2023, Hyundai increased the production rate from around 137 units to 1,000 units per month due to extremely high demand.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-04-17 |title=Pangkas Inden, Hyundai Tambah Pasokan Ioniq 5 Jadi 1.000 Unit Sebulan |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/otomotif/20230417150356-603-938839/pangkas-inden-hyundai-tambah-pasokan-ioniq-5-jadi-1000-unit-sebulan |access-date=2023-04-17 |website=CNN Indonesia |language=id-ID}}</ref>

In September 2023, the Ioniq 5 was updated to include [[Hyundai Blue Link|BlueLink]] telematics system as standard on all variants.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Panji |first=Rizen |date=2023-09-14 |title=The BlueLink Feature On The Hyundai Ioniq 5 Is More Complete, Here Is The Update |url=https://www.carmudi.co.id/journal/fitur-bluelink-pada-hyundai-ioniq-5-lebih-lengkap-ini-pembaruannya/ |access-date=2023-09-14 |website=Carmudi Indonesia |language=id}}</ref>

=== Singapore ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Singapore in January 2023, in 3 grades: Exclusive, Prestige, and Inspiration, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Extra Long Range, with the top grade has AWD (dual motor) setup as standard. Assembled in the country at the [[List of Hyundai Motor Company manufacturing facilities#Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Center in Singapore|Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre]] facility, it is the first vehicle assembled in Singapore in more than 40 years. The plant will initially import the vehicle's fully painted body shell from the Indonesian plant, while other parts are imported from South Korea. The first 100 units are designated as the "First 100" limited edition, with "First 100" badging, "First 100" debossing on the seats, and commemorative number plates.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tan |first=Christopher |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai to roll out first S'pore-assembled cars in first half of 2023 {{!}} The Straits Times |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/hyundai-to-roll-out-first-s-pore-assembled-cars-in-first-half-of-2023 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=www.straitstimes.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 locally assembled in Singapore - CKD units of First 100 edition to get special Merlion badges - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2023/01/11/hyundai-ioniq-5-locally-assembled-in-singapore-ckd-units-of-first-100-edition-to-get-special-merlion-badges/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== India ===
The Ioniq 5 was introduced in India in January 2023 at the [[Auto Expo]]. It is Hyundai's second electric offering for India after the [[Hyundai Kona Electric|Kona Electric]], which was available in the country since 2019. Assembled in the country, the Indian model is solely powered by a 72.6 kWh battery with {{cvt|160|kW|PS hp|0}} and rear-wheel drive.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Auto Expo 2023: Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched at Rs 44.95 lakh |url=https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/auto-expo-2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-at-rs-4495-lakh-426904 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Autocar India}}</ref>

=== Philippines ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in the Philippines in February 2023, in a sole GLS grade, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-04 |title=Here Are The Full Specs Of The 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 For The Philippines |url=https://www.carguide.ph/2023/02/here-are-full-specs-of-2023-hyundai.html |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=CarGuide.PH |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-26 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV coming to dealers next month |url=https://www.autoindustriya.com/auto-industry-news/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-coming-to-dealers-next-month.html |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Auto Industriya |language=en}}</ref>

=== Middle East ===
The Ioniq 5 was launched in the [[Gulf Cooperation Council|GCC]] countries in July 2023. It is powered by a RWD 125 kW (168 hp) single motor with a 58 kWh battery or an AWD dual motor 225 kW (302 hp) with a 72.6 kWh battery.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq Car Prices, Specification, Variants & Features in UAE |url=https://carprices.ae/brands/hyundai/2023/ioniq |access-date=2023-10-12 |website=Carprices.ae |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai MEA launches the all-electric IONIQ range |url=https://www.tradearabia.com/news/MTR_416082.html |access-date=2023-11-24 |website=Trade Arabia}}</ref>

=== Vietnam ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Vietnam on 31 July 2023. Assembled in Vietnam, comes in Exclusive and Prestige grades, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 electric car officially produced and distributed in Vietnam, priced from 1,3 billion VND |url=https://www.vietnam.vn/en/xe-dien-hyundai-ioniq-5-chinh-thuc-san-xuat-va-phan-phoi-tai-viet-nam-gia-tu-13-ty-dong/ |url-status=live |website=vietnam.vn}}</ref>

=== Thailand ===
The Ioniq 5 was introduced in Thailand on 29 November 2023 at Thailand International Motor Expo 2023. Imported from South Korea, with 3 trim levels offered are Premium, Exclusive and First Edition, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-11-29 |title=ราคาอย่างเป็นทางการ Hyundai IONIQ 5 : 1,699,000 – 2,399,000 บาท แบต 58 – 72.6 kWh วิ่งไกลสุด 481 km. (WLTP) |trans-title=Official price Hyundai IONIQ 5 : 1,699,000 – 2,399,000 baht Battery 58 – 72.6 kWh Maximum range 481 km. (WLTP) |url=https://www.headlightmag.com/2023-11-29-official-price-hyundai-ioniq-5-thailand/ |access-date=2023-11-29 |website=HeadLight Magazine |language=th}}</ref>

== Concepts and prototypes ==
=== Robotaxi ===
The Ioniq 5 [[Robotaxi]] was unveiled on 31 August 2021 and displayed at IAA Mobility 2021 on 6 September 2021.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Hyundai's joint venture unveils basic design of robotaxi based on IONIQ 5 |work=Aju Business Daily |url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210901090352760 |access-date=1 September 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Motional To Launch Driverless Robotaxis in Las Vegas in 2023 |work=Forbes |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/samabuelsamid/2021/11/09/motional-to-launch-driverless-robotaxis-in-las-vegas-in-2023/?sh=1b1aa054714e |access-date=9 November 2021}}</ref> Lyft began offering transport by driverless Ioniq 5 Robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip on 16 August 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |date=16 August 2022 |title=Lyft offering driverless robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip |url=https://www.8newsnow.com/news/local-news/lyft-offering-driverless-robotaxis-on-the-las-vegas-strip/ |access-date=22 August 2022 |publisher=KLAS |language=en-US}}</ref> The Ioniq 5 Robotaxi will have a human driver present until the end of 2022, after which the cars will operate on their own.

Since late 2023, the Ioniq 5 Robotaxi are assembled at the Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre facility to be exported to the US.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bellan |first=Rebecca |date=2023-11-21 |title=Motional and Hyundai to jointly build IONIQ 5 robotaxi in Singapore |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/11/21/motional-and-hyundai-to-jointly-build-ioniq-5-robotaxi-in-singapore/ |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}}</ref>

<gallery widths="200" heights="154">
File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0002.jpg|Robotaxi
File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0317.jpg|Rear view
</gallery>

=== Ioniq 5 with e-Corner ===
A modified version of the Ioniq 5 was showcased by [[Hyundai Mobis]] at the [[Consumer Electronics Show#2023|56th Consumer Electronics Show]] in [[Las Vegas]] in January 2023. The vehicle is equipped with an "e-Corner" system which allows it to perform a crab walk, tank turn, diagonal driving and pivot turn. It features an in-wheel motor design that also integrates brake and steer by wire technology as well as an electric damper into a single package. Each wheel can accelerate, brake and steer independently.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 With e-Corner Modules Can Rotate Its Wheels 90 Degrees |url=https://insideevs.com/news/630245/hyundai-ioniq5-crab-walk-360-degrees/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

== Awards ==
* Car of the Year 2021, Mid-size Company Car of the Year 2021, and Premium Electric Car of the Year 2021 from ''[[Auto Express]]'' at the New Car Awards 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |title=New Car Awards 2021: the winners |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/new-car-awards-2021 |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=Auto Express |language=en}}</ref>
* Won 2021 IDEA Design Award gold prize.
* 2022 New Zealand Car of the Year<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 named New Zealand Car of the Year |url=https://www.hyundai.co.nz/hyundai-ioniq-5-named-new-zealand-car-of-the-year |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=Hyundai New Zealand |language=en}}</ref>
* 2022 German Car of the Year
* 2022 'Best Import Cars of the Year' by ''[[Auto Bild]]'', winning the "Electric Car" category.
* Ranked 2022 No. 1 Electric Car by ''[[Autozeitung]]'', receiving the highest score among electric cars.
* Best Design at the '''[[Top Gear (magazine)|Top Gear]]'' Electric Awards 2021'.
* 2022 World Car of the Year, World Electric Vehicle of the Year and World Car Design of the Year from [[World Car Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=19 April 2022 |title=The Hyundai Ioniq 5 Wins The World Car Design of the Year for 2022 |url=https://www.hotcars.com/world-car-design-2022-hyundai-ioniq-5/ |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=HotCars |language=en-US}}</ref>
* 2022 EV of the Year, ''[[Car and Driver]]''<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dyer |first1=Ezra |title=Presenting Car and Driver's 2022 EV of the Year |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a40860789/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-of-the-year/ |access-date=3 September 2022 |work=Car and Driver |date=18 August 2022}}</ref>
* 2022-2023 [[Car of the Year Japan|Japan Import Car of the Year]]<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Wins Japan Import Car of the Year Award – Japanese Car News |url=https://japanesecarnews.com/hyundai-ioniq-5-wins-japan-import-car-of-the-year-award/ |access-date=2022-12-16 |language=en-US}}</ref>
* 2024 <nowiki>''Green Car Award''</nowiki> at the [[Indian Car of the Year|Indian Car of the Year (ICOTY).]]<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 wins Green Car award 2024 by ICOTY |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/auto/cars/story/hyundai-ioniq-5-wins-green-car-award-2024-by-icoty-2478539-2023-12-20 |access-date=21 December 2023 |website=India Today}}</ref>

== Police car ==
In 2023 The [[National Police Agency (South Korea)|Korean National Police Agency]] purchased the Hyundai Ioniq 5 to replace the [[Hyundai Sonata]] police car.
